snippet: Kwame M. Kilpatrick was a rising star when he was elected mayor of Detroit at 31. Now 42, he could face a 30-year prison term.
abstract: Kwame M Kilpatrick was a rising star when he was elected mayor of Detroit in 2002, but now faces a potential 30-year prison term as his federal trial on racketeering, bribery and fraud during his time in public office is set to begin.
lead_paragraph: Kwame M. Kilpatrick was a rising star when he was elected mayor of Detroit at 31. Now 42, he could face a 30-year prison term.

headline.seo: Trial Set to Open for Former Detroit Mayor
headline.main: Federal Trial Set to Open for Ex-Mayor of Detroit
headline.print_headline: Federal Trial Set to Open For Ex-Mayor of Detroit
